intro: Dipteracanthus strepens var. dillenii, commonly known as the Dillenii variant of the genus Dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a glossy surface, and it produces fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. This variant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
